questions.question: What is the name of the apparent paradox that arises from the question of why the night sky is dark if there are so many stars in the universe?
What evidence led to the current acceptance of the Big Bang theory over the Steady State theory?
options: The discovery of cosmic microwave background radiation
questions.correct_answer: The discovery of cosmic microwave background radiation

questions.question: Who first proposed the concept of dark matter?
What is the term for the study of the universe's large-scale structure, including the distribution of galaxies and galaxy clusters?
What hypothetical form of energy is theorized to permeate all of space and cause the acceleration of the expansion of the universe?
What is the current estimate for the age of the universe, according to the Î›CDM concordance model?
Which of the following is not a possible end scenario for our universe according to current cosmological theories?
What does the cosmological principle state about the universe?
options: The universe is infinite and isotropic
The universe is homogeneous and isotropic when viewed on a large enough scale
The universe is cyclic in nature
questions.correct_answer: The universe is homogeneous and isotropic when viewed on a large enough scale

questions.question: What does the Flatness Problem refer to in the context of cosmology?
options: The question of why the observable universe appears to be close to spatially flat
The mystery of why galaxies are mostly flat
The challenge of explaining the absence of curvature in spacetime
The problem of why the Earth appears flat from the human perspective
questions.correct_answer: The question of why the observable universe appears to be close to spatially flat

questions.question: What's the main difference between the WMAP and Planck satellite missions?
options: WMAP measured cosmic microwave background radiation, Planck measured infrared radiation
Planck provided a higher resolution and more accurate measurements than WMAP
WMAP measured the curvature of the universe, Planck measured the flatness
Planck was a follow-up mission to confirm WMAP's discovery of gravitational waves
questions.correct_answer: Planck provided a higher resolution and more accurate measurements than WMAP
